newsitem.title: GERMANY: HOCKEY-SOUTH KOREA DEFEAT AUSTRALIA BUT MISS OUT ON FINAL.
newsitem.headline: HOCKEY-SOUTH KOREA DEFEAT AUSTRALIA BUT MISS OUT ON FINAL.

text.p: South Korea beat Olympic and World Cup hockey champions Australia 3-2 on Saturday in the final match of the round robin series at the women's Champions' trophy, but a win for Germany saw the Koreans squeezed out of Sunday's final.
The Koreans triumphed when Kim Myung-ok converted a penalty stroke with just 106 seconds left, adding to goals by Choi Mi-soon and Lee ji-young.

But their win was in vain as a 2-0 victory for Germany over the Netherlands, with goals by Nadine Ernsting-Krienke and Denise Klecker, meant the hosts finished top of the rankings and play Australia in the final.
South Korea and the Netherlands face a third place play-off on Sunday.
